definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: There are many cases of human rights violations filed before the police.
sentences.chinese: 警方接手許多人權侵犯案件，往往牽連到高級官員。

sentences.english: The catcher was dinged on the head by a wild throw.
sentences.chinese: 那個兇猛的投球打在接手的頭上。

sentences.english: At that price everybody who wanted to buy yen for dollars would find someone who was willing to sell him yen for dollars.
sentences.chinese: 只有在這種兌換價位時，美元出手了纔有人願意接手。

sentences.english: Work on projects after other programmers.
sentences.chinese: 接手別的程序員完成項目。

sentences.english: I'm feeling too tired to drive any more; will you take over?
sentences.chinese: 我累得開不動車了，你來接手好嗎？

sentences.english: Like all the short guys would become receivers, right?
sentences.chinese: 就象讓所有矮個兒都當外接手，對吧？

sentences.english: The team has made much progress since Lucy coached it.
sentences.chinese: 自從露西接手訓練以來，那支隊伍進步非常大。

sentences.english: If you want to take over the task, you must burn your boats.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想接手這項工作，就必須幹到底。

sentences.english: And then when I graduated, he suggested I take over his class.
sentences.chinese: 後來我畢業了，他提議我接手他的課程。

sentences.english: How does that differ from the brand strategy before Converse was acquired by Nike?
sentences.chinese: 在被耐克接手之前，匡威的品牌戰略有何不同？

sentences.english: After the items of the project and decided, the engineering team will take over.
sentences.chinese: 報價的各項內容一旦確定，工程隊就正式接手。

sentences.english: Its first challenge with Guangdong will be to improve operations.
sentences.chinese: 改善經營將是花旗接手廣發銀行後面臨的首要問題。

sentences.english: First: It hired a team from Gray Robinson to start working on the case.
sentences.chinese: 第一，從格雷羅賓森僱傭了一支團隊接手這個案子。

sentences.english: The house and contents were left to the National Trust.
sentences.chinese: 蕭的住宅和宅內物什由國民託管組織接手。

sentences.english: In the past three years she has taken on 50 or 60 cases.
sentences.chinese: 這三年來，她已經接手了五六十個任務。

sentences.english: After this human beings take over and defuse and remove the mine.
sentences.chinese: 然後便由人類接手，拆去雷管並移除地雷。

definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
(of property) to change owners/(of sovereignty, political power etc) to change hands
to succeed sb in a job/successor
to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
